1. Print the calibration grid and marker images.
 2. Cut out several markers to use later.
 3. Keep the calibration grid complete.
 4. Start using the app!!!
From app setting, you can choose the type of marker you are going to use.\n

1. Open the app menu and press the calibration button.
 2. Take some pictures of the calibration grid from different angles.
 3. At the end of this process, you could see a confirmation message and the accuracy error.
 4. TIP: Each resolution available on your device needs to be calibrated.
1. Place your markers where you want, even in the angle you want: on the floor, on the table, on the wall, on your monitor…\n 2. Make sure the camera is already calibrated.\n

1. Open the app menu and press the mapping button.
 2. Take photos of the markers.
 3. Every picture should contain at least two markers.
 4. You must connect new markers with markers previously captured.
 5. Once all the markers are captured, you can create the map.
You can open and view the created maps using the visualiser.
Use these movements to control the visualiser.
You have several options to manage your maps, including sending maps to external devices.
You can start the cube tester from the b visualiser screen to evaluate the created map.\n Make sure that the markers are still placed in the same position as in the opened map.\n
